185848724.review: La heroína es un juego de niños en comparación con esto. Dile  adiós a tus amigos, tu familia, tu trabajo y a ti mismo. Al principio te meterás a jugar con Alemania, E.E.U.U, España... y harás cosas bonitas, empezarás a pasártelo bien y cuando te des cuenta vas a estar jugando con un país de 100 mil habitantes y sin ejército mientras peleas contra 3 potencias mundiales para formar una nación nueva. Después de muchos intentos y estar constantemente preguntándote a ti mismo "¿Quién me manda a mí a hacer esto?" lo conseguirás y por fin podrás ver que tu país de mierda ahora no es azul sino morado. Y lo que te queda no es satisfacción sino un sentimiento constante de vacío existencial. Pero eso es solo la mitad la historia, después de años de reclusión aprendiendo al milímetro cada mecánica de este juego/estilo de vida, decidirás que puede ser buena idea jugar al online. Te meterás en un discord con gente bastante rara, pero aun así decides jugar con ellos. Te piensas que eres el puto amo pero se destruirán todos tus sueños cuando veas que un boliviano aún más sudoroso  y miserable que tú, ha destruido a tu ejército de 100 mil soldados con 2 alpacas y un chamán de dudosa procedencia. Nota 11/10

185431829.review:
Victoria 2 is a grand strategy game that places players at the helm of a nation during the 19th and early 20th centuries. Covering the transformative years from 1836 to 1936, the game challenges players to manage politics, economy, diplomacy, and warfare while navigating historical events and shaping their nation’s destiny. With its intricate mechanics and deep strategic gameplay, Victoria 2 offers a compelling experience for history and strategy enthusiasts.

[b]Key Features:[/b]

[b]Complex Political Systems:[/b] Victoria 2 features a detailed political simulation where players must manage government types, parties, and policies. Balancing the needs of various social groups and political movements is key to maintaining stability and achieving national goals.

[b]Economic Depth:[/b] Players oversee their nation’s economy, including industrialization, trade, and resource management. The game’s intricate economic model challenges players to balance supply and demand while fostering growth in their nation’s industries.

[b]Population Management:[/b] The game introduces a unique "POP" system, where population groups are categorized by profession, culture, and ideology. Managing these groups effectively is crucial to addressing social issues and fostering national prosperity.

[b]Diplomacy and Warfare:[/b] Players engage in complex diplomacy, forming alliances, negotiating treaties, and waging wars. The balance of power system ensures that aggressive actions can have far-reaching consequences, requiring careful planning and strategy.

[b]Technological Advancements:[/b] Research and development play a vital role in modernizing a nation. Players can unlock new technologies and reforms that impact military strength, economic efficiency, and social progress.

[b]Dynamic Historical Events:[/b] The game incorporates historical events and decisions, offering players the opportunity to rewrite history or follow its course. These events add depth and immersion to the gameplay.

[b]Modding Community:[/b] Victoria 2 boasts an active modding community that has created extensive modifications, enhancing replayability and allowing players to customize their experience.

[b]Conclusion:[/b]
Victoria 2 stands out as a deep and rewarding grand strategy game that combines intricate mechanics with historical accuracy. Its emphasis on political, economic, and social management provides a unique and immersive experience, making it a must-play for fans of complex strategy games. Whether you’re uniting nations, industrializing economies, or shaping global diplomacy, Victoria 2 offers an unparalleled journey through one of history’s most transformative eras.

184781552.review:
Victoria 2 es un excelente juego de estrategia donde puedes elegir cualquier pais y enfrentar desafios unicos. si decides jugar como Mexico, preparate para una experiencia divertida pero frustrante. Desde el inicio, tienes que enfrentarte a Texas y lidiar con el metiche de Estados Unidos, que siempre esta listo para arruinar tus planes y fastidiarte con su intervencion innecesaria. 

La combinacion de diplomacia, economia, y guerra hace que cada partida sea intensa. Pero cuidado, porque cuando parece que todo va bien, Estados Unidos llega a meter su nariz donde nadie lo llamo. Complicando tus avances.

En resumen, Victoria 2 es una joya para los amantes de las estrategia, pero si juegas como Mexico, preparate para lidiar con el vecino mas molesto del mapa

184542714.review:
[h1] Una vez que lo dominas no vas a parar [/h1]
Un juego impresionante con una gran variedad de mecánicas por dominar. Según Steam, tengo 121 horas jugadas, pero les aseguro que han sido muchas más. Descubrí este maravilloso título durante la pandemia, y puedo decir con certeza que es el mejor de la trilogía. Si están considerando comprarlo, les recomiendo adquirir la edición completa, ya que la versión base se queda corta en cuanto a contenido.

Aunque el juego no cuenta con una tienda de mods integrada en Steam, la posibilidad de descargarlos desde Internet es bastante sencilla, lo que ofrece horas adicionales de diversión.

Por último, quiero compartirles algunas recomendaciones de países  para jugar.

[h2] Si eres nuevo te recomiendo [/h2]

-[b] España [/b]

-[b] Italia [/b]

-[b] Austria [/b]


[h2] Países mas complejos pero divertidos [/h2]

-[b] Prusia [/b]

-[b] Japón [/b]

-[b] Imperio otomano [/b]

-[b] Persia [/b]

184172394.review:
Having played Victoria 3 before this, it's really interesting to see the "DNA" of this game that went into its successor. There's a lot more to enjoy here in some regards, but one thing Victoria 3 does better is giving you information. For example, it's a lot easier to see how to move through forms of government in V3 though its elaborate tooltips -- here in V2, a lot more information is hidden, harder to find, or unexplained outside of the manual. For lack of a manual on my desk, I even had to look up what combat stats like "support" are doing on the wiki. (nb, the game does come with a PDF manual, which can be found on the store page and in the game's installed files)

Speaking of combat, the combat system seems a little less sophisticated than EU4, one of the other historic Paradox titles I'm used to. This is a maybe a good thing, but I did kind of find it funny that the AI was only ever going to circle the Ivory Coast to land on exactly the closest tile to its homeland, over and over. It made setting up a defensive stack as Sokoto and just wiping out wave after wave of Danish troops pretty straightforward. I managed to hold on for surprisingly long at 31 infamy until I was at war with both Spain & Italy at the same time, when I decided that history had run its course for my little broke nation and quit my save.

Anyway, do NOT go over 25 infamy, do not trust laissez-faire as a tertiary power, and DO have fun!

183566880.review:
A timeless classic. As my first PDX game, it has never disappointed me. Back in 2015, my kid-self who loved history was absolutely blown away with how games like this existed. Thank you PDX for making one of my childhood dreams come true.

This game is a hollow shell without mods due to its age, so mods like GFM are what made me enjoy this game at its full potential. And yes, I HIGHLY recommend GFM.
